articles.author: MIKE STOBBE
articles.title: COVID-19 no longer means five days in isolation, CDC says - The Associated Press
articles.description: U.S. health officials say Americans with COVID-19 no longer need to stay in isolation for five days. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention changed its longstanding guidance on Friday. People can return to work or regular activities if their symptoms …
articles.content:
NEW YORK (AP) Americans who test positive for COVID-19 no longer need to stay in isolation for five days, U.S. health officials announced Friday.
